attributes.overallObjectives: Students will master the fundamentals of digital music production, including sound design, mixing, and music arrangement. Through hands-on experience with industry-standard digital audio workstations, students will develop technical skills while exploring creative expression. The course combines theoretical understanding of music technology with practical production techniques.
classObjectives: Week 1 | DAW Fundamentals: Master the interface and basic workflow of digital audio workstations
Week 2 | Sound Design: Create and manipulate synthetic sounds using various synthesis methods
Week 3 | Recording Techniques: Learn microphone placement and digital recording practices
Week 4 | MIDI Production: Explore electronic music creation and virtual instruments
Week 5 | Mixing Essentials: Study EQ, compression, and effects processing
Week 6 | Arrangement: Develop song structure and orchestration techniques
Week 7 | Music Business: Understand licensing, distribution, and marketing
Week 8 | Final Project: Produce and release an original music collection
